thread.title: No 10 falls for Valentine's Day hoax after comedian claims Donald Trump wants to send Theresa May flowers
thread.title_full: No 10 falls for Valentine's Day hoax after comedian claims Donald Trump wants to send Theresa May flowers

author: Steven Swinford
title: No 10 falls for Valentine's Day hoax after comedian claims Donald Trump wants to send Theresa May flowers
text:
News No 10 falls for Valentine's Day hoax after comedian claims Donald Trump wants to send Theresa May flowers Donald Trump and Theresa May during her recent visit to the US Credit: Stephen Crowley/The New York Times/Stephen Crowley/The New York Times Steven Swinford , Deputy Political Editor  00am 
D owning Street was tricked into thinking that Donald Trump wanted to send Theresa May flowers for Valentine's day. 
Heydon Prowse, a comic, rang Downing Street claiming to work for White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer and suggesting that Mr Trump wanted to send a bouquet. 
The Downing Street aide called Mr Trump back and clarified further details, asking: "Can I check who the gift is coming from?" Watch | Donald Trump and Theresa May hold hands ahead of joint press conference 00:56 
M r Prowse replied: "It's essentially from Mr Trump but Sean Spicer is organising it." 
She replied: "Ah yes, I see, fantastic. OK, my hunch is hydrangeas." 
Mr Prowse said: "OK, what we'll also do is we'll send over a lovely card with a picture of Mr Trump grabbing Theresa May's p****, I mean hand, sorry, (aide laughs and says 'Oh God') â€” I meant hand obviously, sorry, that was a slip of the tongue." Watch | Donald Trump's alpha male body language 01:40 
"Please pass Mr Trump's regards on to Theresa because really he is such a lovely man and he had such a lovely time with Theresa he just wants to pass that on to her, OK? The aide replied: "Of course, I will certainly relay that message." 
T he Don't Panic advertising agency was behind the sting. A spokesman for No 10 declined to comment. Follow Telegraph News
